content.description: Wooly Mammoth is 10a if you move right at the 6th bolt (the area in the shadow below the juniper in the photo below) and then move left again to join the bolt line.
content.protection: 9 bolts? One long trad draw is helpful at the 5th bolt but not required.
content.location:
It is 10 feet to the right of

Woolite

- the obvious bolt line that starts above a small thumb against the main face.

content.description: Start in an obvious crack (#0.75 or 2 Camalot) to the first high bolt. Follow great edges and jugs through a Gunks style roof. A 1 foot sling on the bolt below the roof will help with rope drag. Continue to a shared anchor with the two routes to the left.
content.protection:
7 bolts and a #0.75 or #2 Camalot....

Per

Rich Kelly

: there are 12 bolts.
content.location: It is the fourth route from the left.

content.description: Woolite is a great warm-up on the right side of the wall. Start off the ledge on the left, and engage the low crux roof. The upper, golden arete finish is very nice.
content.location: It is on the far right side on the upper platform.

content.description: This is the first route on the left side of the Main Area. Climb up some chossy looking rock with great edges and jugs that climbs way better than it looks. This is a steep, fun outing....
content.location: It is the first route on the left side of the main area....

content.description:
Smashing Young Ram has good climbing on bullet rock.

Crank and crimp the boulder problem crux, then continue on good rock to the anchors.
content.location: It ascends the overhang just right of where the approach trail hits the cliff.

content.description:
Mmmm, Haggis.... Â Follow the crack system to the right of

Wooly Bully

to the first high bolt (#2 cam). A small bulge and mostly moderate climbing leads to the gear protected crux bulge. (0.4 and 0.5 cams). The bulge is slightly committing due to the choss nugget that you are yanking on and the ledge below your feet. Angle left past a couple more bolts to an anchor.
content.location:
Start as for

Wooly Bully

, but angle right in the crack the system....

content.description: Climb the face to the left of the small, left-facing dihedral. Plug in some trad gear (#0.5 and 0.75 Camalots), and traverse right. Continue up through a few bulges, and pass a set of anchors without rings to a shared anchor with the two routes to the right.
content.location: It is the second route on the left side of the wall.
